qas.question: What consequence of establishing the Scottish Parliament applies to Scottish MPs sitting in the UK House of Commons?

answers.text: able to vote on domestic legislation that applies only to England, Wales and Northern Ireland
able to vote on domestic legislation that applies only to England, Wales and Northern Ireland

qas.question: What are MPs unable to vote upon?

answers.text: domestic legislation of the Scottish Parliament
domestic legislation of the Scottish Parliament.
domestic legislation of the Scottish Parliament

qas.question: What phenomenon has led to criticism?
What party had a victory in the 2015 UK election?
MPs representing English constituencies can only veto laws affecting which country?

plausible_answers.text: English, Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish Westminster MPs are unable to vote on the domestic legislation of the Scottish Parliament

qas.question: The West Lutheran question is known as what?

plausible_answers.text: give MPs representing English constituencies a new "veto" over laws only affecting England

qas.question: Following the Liberal victory in 2015, standing orders were changed to do what?
Who was victorious in the 2005 UK election?
What question has not led to criticism?

context: A <a0_2>procedural consequence<a0_2/> of the establishment of the Scottish Parliament is that Scottish MPs sitting in the UK House of Commons are <a0_0><a0_1>able to vote on domestic legislation that applies only to England, Wales and Northern Ireland<a0_1/><a0_0/> – whilst <b5_0>English, Scottish, Welsh and Northern Irish Westminster MPs are unable to vote on the <a1_0><a1_1><a1_2>domestic legislation of the Scottish Parliament<b5_0/><a1_2/><a1_0/>.<a1_1/> This phenomenon is known as <a2_2><b8_0>the <a2_0><a2_1>West Lothian question<b8_0/><a2_2/><a2_1/><a2_0/> and has led to criticism. Following <a3_0>the <a3_1><a3_2><b7_0>Conservative<b7_0/><a3_2/><a3_1/><a3_0/> victory in the 2015 UK election, standing orders of the House of Commons were changed to <b6_0>give MPs representing English constituencies a new "veto" over laws only affecting <a4_0><a4_1><a4_2>England<b6_0/><a4_2/><a4_1/><a4_0/>.
